item.title: How To Set Up Hyperion; Using Eclipse IDE - Step By Step Guide
item.dc:creator: @simon7772 simon7772@hotmail.com
item.description:
@simon7772 wrote:

Hey can you please help me or refer me to a tutorial on the paths because i get this error:

29/04/2011 7:29:25 PM org.hyperion.Server main
INFO: Starting Hyperion...
29/04/2011 7:29:25 PM org.hyperion.rs2.model.ItemDefinition init
INFO: Loading definitions...
29/04/2011 7:29:25 PM org.hyperion.fileserver.FileServer bind
INFO: Binding to port : 43595...
29/04/2011 7:29:25 PM org.hyperion.fileserver.FileServer bind
INFO: Binding to port : 8080...
29/04/2011 7:29:25 PM org.hyperion.fileserver.FileServer start
INFO: Ready
29/04/2011 7:29:25 PM org.hyperion.Server main
SEVERE: Error starting Hyperion.
java.io.FileNotFoundException: data\configuration.cfg (The system cannot find the path specified)
	at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method)
	at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:106)
	at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:66)
	at org.hyperion.rs2.model.World.loadConfiguration(World.java:179)
	at org.hyperion.rs2.model.World.init(World.java:167)
	at org.hyperion.rs2.RS2Server.<init>(RS2Server.java:49)
	at org.hyperion.Server.main(Server.java:36)

Read full topic
item.source: How To Set Up Hyperion; Using Eclipse IDE - Step By Step Guide

item.title: How To Set Up Hyperion; Using Eclipse IDE - Step By Step Guide
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Okay the first error is something to do with MySQL? Looks like you’re missing something. I don’t really understand it. The second error you’re already running on that port.

item.title: How To Set Up Hyperion; Using Eclipse IDE - Step By Step Guide
item.dc:creator: @durial12 durial12
item.description:
@durial12 wrote:

I’m getting this:

Apr 8, 2011 12:35:46 AM org.rs2server.Server main INFO: Starting Hyperion... Apr 8, 2011 12:35:46 AM org.rs2server.Server main INFO: Reading config file... java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.mysql.jdbc.Driver at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:202) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:190) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:307) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:248) at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method) at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:169) at org.rs2server.rs2.database.ConnectionDriver.<init>(ConnectionDriver.java:19) at org.rs2server.rs2.database.impl.LoginConnection.<clinit>(LoginConnection.java:32) at org.rs2server.rs2.model.World.init(World.java:291) at org.rs2server.rs2.RS2Server.<init>(RS2Server.java:47) at org.rs2server.Server.main(Server.java:53) Apr 8, 2011 12:35:46 AM org.rs2server.rs2.model.ObjectManager load INFO: Loading definitions... Apr 8, 2011 12:35:46 AM org.rs2server.rs2.RS2Server bind INFO: Binding to port : 43594... Apr 8, 2011 12:35:46 AM org.rs2server.Server main SEVERE: Error starting Hyperion. java.net.BindException: Address already in use at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Native Method) at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketChannelImpl.bind(ServerSocketChannelImpl.java:126) at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketAdaptor.bind(ServerSocketAdaptor.java:59) at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.NioSocketAcceptor.open(NioSocketAcceptor.java:251) at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.NioSocketAcceptor.open(NioSocketAcceptor.java:48) at org.apache.mina.core.polling.AbstractPollingIoAcceptor.registerHandles(AbstractPollingIoAcceptor.java:523) at org.apache.mina.core.polling.AbstractPollingIoAcceptor.access$200(AbstractPollingIoAcceptor.java:65) at org.apache.mina.core.polling.AbstractPollingIoAcceptor$Acceptor.run(AbstractPollingIoAcceptor.java:407) at org.apache.mina.util.NamePreservingRunnable.run(NamePreservingRunnable.java:64) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:680)

item.description:
@darkgriever2 wrote:

Ok so i get this error even though data/configuration.cfg is in the data folder so i figured it was in the wrong data folder but when i moved it to the src data folder i get the same error

SEVERE: Error starting Hyperion. java.io.FileNotFoundException: data\configuration.cfg (The system cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileInputStream.(Unknown Source) at org.hyperion.rs2.model.World.loadConfiguration(World.java:179) at org.hyperion.rs2.model.World.init(World.java:167) at org.hyperion.rs2.RS2Server.(RS2Server.java:49) at org.hyperion.Server.main(Server.java:36)

EDIT
nevermind i had the project folder setup to a diffrent location from the source folder

item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

Integrated development environment

An integrated development environment (IDE) is a software application that provides comprehensive facilities to computer programmers for software development. An IDE normally consists of at least a source code editor, build automation tools, and a debugger. Some IDEs, such as NetBeans and Eclipse, contain the necessary compiler, interpreter, or both; others, such as SharpDevelop and Lazarus, do not. The boundary between an IDE and other parts of the broader software development environment is no...

If you don’t want to use an IDE (like me) you can see

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

I changed some things around for my specific use :S

item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

sokuamuag:

is this work on server 508?

Holy shit, don’t quote the whole post. Anyways, Hyperion is a 317 protocol source, but Eclipse is just an IDE, so the program itself can be used to edit any ‘508 server’.
